title: Twitter, TikTok Have Held Preliminary Talks About Possible Combination
summary: Microsoft still seen as front-runner in bidding for video-sharing app's U.S. operations. Twitter Inc. has had preliminary talks about a potential combination with TikTok, the popular video-sharing app that the Trump administration has declared a national-security threat due to its Chinese ownership, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Clashes Erupt in Beirut Over Deadly Explosion
summary: Protesters say they want leaders held accountable for years of poor governance and corruption. BEIRUT-Tens of thousands of protesters converged Saturday on central Beirut, some clashing with security forces and taking over government buildings, as they demanded justice for a deadly explosion in the Lebanese capital they blame on their leaders.

title: U.S. Covid-19 Cases Near Five Million
summary: Confirmed coronavirus cases surpass 19.4 million world-wide, with more than 723,000 people dead. The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the U.S. closed in on five million as political tensions over economic aid for struggling Americans heightened in Washington.

title: 5 Myths About Stock Diversification
summary: No. 1: You don't really get much benefit going beyond 12 to 18 stocks. Wrong.. Diversification is often described as the only free lunch in investing-reducing a portfolio's risk without reducing expected return. This idea of spreading money across different kinds of investments is so accepted and so straightforward that it is a fundamental principle that even the most unsophisticated investors know about it.

title: While Covid-19 Donations Soar, Other Charities See a Big Hit to Funds
summary: Canceled galas, auctions and fundraisers undermine giving; 'we're not in position to survive another couple of years of this,' says the director of a nonprofit. When the pandemic hit, the blow to ReInspire, a nonprofit in Johnson County, Texas, was swift and sudden. Executive Director Charise Olson could no longer counsel teens at schools, the library or fast-food restaurants, all of which had closed. She had to cancel classes in job and life skills, and let go five interns and other workers.

title: NAACP Wades Into Fight Over Purdue Pharma's Role in Opioid Crisis
summary: Communities of color have been left out of talks about how to divide billions of damages, NAACP says. The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People is asking for a seat at the table in the Purdue Pharma LP's bankruptcy case to make sure communities of color get a fair share of billions of dollars in drug-crisis damages.

title: The Mid-American Becomes First Top-Tier Conference to Cancel Football in Fall
summary: The move comes before the sport's biggest conferences make a decision on whether to proceed with the 2020 season. The Mid-American Conference won't play sports including football this fall because of health concerns posed by the coronavirus pandemic, becoming the first league in the top-tier Football Bowl Subdivision to punt on sports.

title: Game Isn't Over for Pinball Machines After New York Arcade Closes
summary: Steve Zahler keeps silver ball in play by selling many of his machines to his most loyal customers. When Steve Zahler decided a few weeks ago to permanently close Modern Pinball, the arcade in Manhattan's Kips Bay neighborhood that he had owned and run for nearly the past seven years, it seemed like another woeful tale of a business that failed because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Nursing Home Deaths Are Rising Again, Federal Data Show
summary: Increase follows community outbreaks in Sunbelt states. After dropping in June, Covid-19 deaths in nursing homes have begun to rise again, fueled by increases in states including Texas and Florida that saw coronavirus surges in the broader population, according to new federal data.

title: Lawmakers' Efforts to Restart PPP Stalled by Broader Fight
summary: Democrats and Republicans hope to reopen window for applications, offer second round of aid to smallest businesses. The deadline for small businesses to apply for forgivable loans from the Paycheck Protection Program is Saturday, but bipartisan efforts designed to improve and extend the program have been hampered by the slow pace of talks between White House and Democratic negotiators on a broader coronavirus aid deal.

title: Teachers' Back-to-School List: Masks, Face Shields, Scrubs
summary: Many states and districts say they will provide protective equipment, but some teachers are anxious about when the gear will arrive and what it will include. Teachers are stocking up on face coverings, hoping to protect themselves and their students from the coronavirus as some U.S. schools begin in-person instruction.

title: Alabama Isn't Giving Up on Playing Football This Fall
summary: Although the football team has seen a mini-outbreak of Covid-19, the school has been trying to make the case that its campus is the safest place for athletes at the moment. Alabama's blockbuster opening game has been canceled, the football team has weathered a mini-outbreak of Covid-19 and the Crimson Tide's celebrity coach is urging Alabamians to wear masks as the coronavirus pandemic surges all around him.

title: What Is the Economic VIX?
summary: Stocks tend to do well during times of extreme economic volatility. Many investors are familiar with the VIX, or volatility index, that measures how much investors expect to see the S&P 500 index fluctuate.

title: Berkshire's Profit Jumps as Market Rebound Boosts Results
summary: Warren Buffett's conglomerate reported second-quarter net earnings of $26.3 billion. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. said its second-quarter earnings surged 86%, as a rebound in the stock market offset a profit decline in the company's operations and a large write-down for Precision Castparts Corp.

title: As Inventories Swell, Companies Turn to Novel Strategies to Get Through Coronavirus Crisis
summary: Logistics specialists that buy and hold goods for clients are increasingly in-demand as companies look to reduce costs. Companies that have stockpiled more goods during the coronavirus pandemic are turning to creative strategies to put inventory to work and generate cash.

title: Qualcomm Lobbies U.S. to Sell Chips for Huawei 5G Phones
summary: Smartphone chip maker warns of potentially losing billions of dollars in sales because of export limits. The American chip company Qualcomm Inc. is lobbying the Trump administration to roll back restrictions on the sale of advanced components to the Chinese telecom giant Huawei Technologies Co., wading into the intensifying technology battle between the U.S. and China.

title: All Agnès, All in One Place
summary: The titanic filmmaker Agnès Varda, who treated features, documentaries and shorts with equal regard, has her complete oeuvre collected into a handsome set from Criterion..

title: 'Welcome to Hard Times' by Charley Crockett Review: A Rogue Spirit's Tales of Trouble
summary: The Texas-born singer-songwriter delivers a sometimes bluntly cynical album that evokes honky tonk, soul, and rock 'n' roll..

title: Life Without TikTok? U.S. Marketers Contemplate Their Options
summary: If the Trump ban comes to pass, advertisers might move to other, newer platforms. But right now, they're not canceling their TikTok ads. President Trump's new limits on TikTok are again pressing marketers to prepare for the day they could lose access to the fast-growing social-media app, a conduit to the young audiences they covet.

title: A Warm-Up That Can Double as a Workout
summary: Resume Subscription. Anatomy of a Workout is a new column where sports performance coaches and athletic trainers break down exercises and drills they use with the pros. Each column will focus on functional movements that help build overall athleticism and translate to everyday activities.

title: If You Need Cash Now, Here's Which Accounts You Should Tap First
summary: Avoid taking money from retirement funds if you can. But all sources of money have pros and cons.. With millions out of work and struggling to pay bills, lots of people don't know where to turn to find the money they need to cover day-to-day expenses and large unexpected costs, like medical bills.

title: Losing Money Is a Winning Pandemic Tax Strategy for Some Companies
summary: Rules designed to help struggling companies conserve cash and get refunds may also encourage tax arbitrage. WASHINGTON-There's a simple rule for corporate tax planning in 2020: If you're going to lose money, lose a lot of money.

title: When the CEO Can't Get on a Plane, Deputies Step Up
summary: With business travel at a standstill, local managers find themselves with longer to-do lists and greater authority. With plane-hopping chief executives grounded by the pandemic, deputies in local offices are playing bigger roles in everything from strategy to hiring.

title: Transport ETFs Look to Recover
summary: iShares Transportation Average and SPDR S&P Transportation are off their lows but down for the year. Transportation is a barometer of economic health, so stocks in the sector took a beating during the initial pandemic lockdowns. But as the economy begins to reopen, could investors grab opportunities in these stocks?

title: Air India Express Jet Overshoots Runway, Killing 18
summary: Boeing 737 craft was carrying 190 people from Dubai to Calicut. NEW DELHI-An Air India Express flight carrying 190 people overshot the runway amid heavy rain in southern India, according to the country's civil-aviation agency.

title: U.S. Sanctions Chinese Officials Over Hong Kong Policy-Including Carrie Lam
summary: U.S. accuses China of undermining Hong Kong's political autonomy. WASHINGTON-The U.S. levied sanctions on some of Hong Kong's leading officials and China's top enforcers of Beijing's clampdown on the territory, ratcheting up the Trump administration's use of sanctions against senior Chinese political figures.

title: It's Time to Revive the Anglosphere
summary: The U.K. should form a new union with Canada, Australia and New Zealand to work as a global partner of the U.S.. How will Great Britain survive Brexit and prosper in a world solidifying into the three empire blocs of the U.S., China and the European Union? One answer is to realize the concept of the "Canzuk Union," a vital first step on the way to a fully functioning Anglosphere.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: As E-Commerce Booms, Robots Pick Up Human Slack
summary: The Covid-19 pandemic and the explosion in demand for home-delivered goods means FedEx and other shippers are pushing the limits of what robotic arms can do. Sue, Randall, Colin and Bobby are four of the most reliable workers at the FedEx Express World Hub in Memphis, Tenn., according to their supervisors. Each clocks eight hours a day of steady work, sorting around 1,300 packages an hour from bins onto a conveyor-four hours on the day shift and another four at night. They almost never take breaks, but since they're still learning on the job, they do regularly call on coworkers in the facility for help. Sue, for instance, has had some trouble with the soft bags in which clothing is typically shipped.

title: How to Travel Luxuriously in the Summer of Covid-19, From Private Jets to Hotel Buyouts
summary: If you've ever wanted a spa resort-or dude ranch-all to yourself, now's the time. In the name of social distancing, high-end hotels and travel companies are selling pampered privacy. And it doesn't come cheap.. NOW THAT Covid-19 has made extroverts into agoraphobes and sent even the most social of butterflies back into the cocoon, the loonily extravagant world of private jets, cliff-side villas and ultraexclusive hotels has begun to seem...strangely sensible.

title: How to Score Major Furniture Finds (and Savings) on Sites Like Craigslist
summary: Thanks to Americans' Covid-driven purges, offerings on peer-to-peer resale sites are surging. Design pros reveal strategies for treasure-hunting online, and share their best discoveries.. RESELLER SITES like Facebook Marketplace and Craigslist have long held a reputation for being only slightly more curated than the curb. But now that quarantined homeowners have had time to spring-clean all summer, "online marketplaces are brimming with rare vintage and quality contemporary décor," said Chicago designer Lauren Svenstrup, of Studio Sven. Take the Milo Baughman-style vintage sofa she found on Facebook Marketplace for $120. Or the $1,000 Moroso YY Chair Brooklyn architect Tal Schori snagged from Craigslist for $200. Here, tips on finding your own high-end deals.

title: Take-Two, Microsoft, Capital One: Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Here are seven major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news. Take-Two Interactive Software Inc.

title: Joe Biden's 2020 VP Pick Draws Closer
summary: Mr. Biden has been expected to interview candidates this week and announce decision next week. Joe Biden is nearing a decision on his running mate for the November election, as some of his top choices face scrutiny over their past statements and records.

title: Joe Arpaio Loses Sheriff's Race in Second Failed Comeback Bid
summary: Mr. Arpaio on Friday was narrowly defeated in his bid to win back the sheriff's post in metro Phoenix that he held for 24 years before being voted out in 2016 amid voter frustrations. PHOENIX (AP)-Joe Arpaio on Friday was narrowly defeated in his bid to win back the sheriff's post in metro Phoenix that he held for 24 years before being voted out in 2016 amid voter frustrations over his taxpayer-funded legal bills, his penchant for self-promotion and a defiant streak that led to his now-pardoned criminal conviction.

title: Trump Prepares Executive Actions as Coronavirus-Aid Talks Stall
summary: President says he is preparing to move forward with extending jobless aid and suspending payroll tax, but Democrats argue his relief powers are limited. WASHINGTON-President Trump said he was prepared to move forward with executive orders to provide more coronavirus aid to Americans, after White House negotiations with Democrats made no progress toward agreements on unemployment benefits and state and local aid, two of the central issues in the talks.

title: Lebanon Leaders Evade Blame for Beirut Explosion Amid Calls for Fresh Protests
summary: As anger swirls over suspected negligence leading to the blast, senior officials back a probe that has focused on junior officials. BEIRUT-Lebanon's leaders sought to deflect blame for a massive explosion that killed more than 150 people and injured thousands more, throwing their weight behind a probe that has focused on junior officials, as protesters geared up for protests against the country's political elite.

title: Russia Working to Damage Biden's White House Bid, Spy Agencies Say
summary: In public report, senior counterintelligence official says China prefers Trump to lose, while Iran aims to undermine U.S. democracy. WASHINGTON-The U.S. intelligence community has assessed that Russia has undertaken a broad effort to damage Democratic Joe Biden's bid for the presidency, while China prefers that President Trump not win re-election, a senior intelligence official said Friday.
